author: COMSOL
description: When the VdaraÂ® hotel first opened in Las Vegas, visitors relaxing by the pool would experience intense periods of heat at certain times of the day, at certain times of the year. This intense heat was caused by the reflection of solar radiation from the curved, reflective surface on the south-facing side of the hotel. This example shows how a caustic surface is generated in the pool area around the time and date the problems were first reported.
label: vdara_caustic_surface.mph
